episode_title: 715 - The One With Joey’s New Brain

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica, Chandler, Ross, and Rachel are sitting around the table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m glad you’re here, we have a couple of things to ask you about the wedding ceremony.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s the matter? You okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, it’s just y’know…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Monica said wedding.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, so anyway, we thought one of you could read something during the ceremony.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh! I would love to read a poem.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you think you could get through a poem?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’ll be a short one.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, so Ross will be doing the reading.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohhh…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay. Yeah, I guess, I guess I could do that too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Too?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I kind of uh, have something else planned for you guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you mind telling us what it is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry, I’m kinda keeping this one on the Q.T.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, whatever it is, I hope it involves winking. (Winks in a spy-type manner.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I just talked to one of the DOOL writers today, and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is DOOL?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Days Of Our Lives . Anyway, you’re not gonna believe it! My character is coming out of his coma!!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Oh!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And-and-and not only that, I’m gettin’ a new brain!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So great things are happening at work and in your personal life!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait, what do you mean you’re getting a new brain?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well, they’re killing off one of the characters on the show, and when she dies her brain is being transplanted into my body.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What? A brain transplant?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, it’s a highly controversial procedure.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s ridiculous!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I think it’s ridiculous that you haven’t had sex in three and a half months.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s winter, they are fewer people on the street. (Rachel and Monica smile and nod, knowingly.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Who are they killing off?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh Cecilia Monroe, she plays Jessica Lockhart.

content.speaker: Rachel and Monica
content.text: Noo!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She’s my favorite character on DOOL.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nice.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She is so good at throwing drinks in people’s faces, I mean I don’t think I’ve ever seen her finish a beverage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And the way she slaps all the time!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wouldn’t you love to do it just once?! (Raises her hand towards Chandler.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Don’t do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Cecilia Monroe man, what a great actress.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, tell me about it. And she’s been on the show forever, it’s gonna be really hard to fill her shoes.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah-yeah, help me out here, when you come out of the “brain transplant,” you are going to be her?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes, but in Drake Ramoray’s body. (Ross laughs unbelievably.) Why is this so hard for you to get? I thought you were a scientist!

content.description: Phoebe and Rachel sitting on the couch in Central Perk

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rach, so, that guy there. Straight or gay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’d have to say gay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah? Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well mainly because he’s kissing that other guy.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh no not that guy there. That guy right there. (Pointing to an attractive man sitting at a table behind them.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah he’s too cute to be straight.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh knockers will help us figure it out. (She walks by and he checks her out.)
content.parenthetical: A woman with large breasts walks in the door

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, straight, and not subtle. (The man gets up and leaves.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, he left his cell phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, well, we can hand it to Gunther and he’ll put it in lost and found.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or we could use it to call China. See how those guys are doing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What if, um, if he calls his own cell phone to find out who found it and I answer and we start talking and we fall in love. I mean wouldn’t that be a great story? Kind of like a fairy tale for the digital age.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah… That does sound great. I’m going to get the phone. (They both get up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Wait! Why…why do you get the story?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. I haven’t been out on a date in so long.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, you had a date three days ago.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That wasn’t a date! That was, that was just friends getting together…(quietly) having sex.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. Okay, see? I get the phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No way! No way! You just broke with Tag a week ago.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! (Breaking up) And until now, I didn’t think I’d love again.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nice try.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh hey-hey wait! How do we fairly decide who gets the phone?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know.
(They edge closer to the phone on the table.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well umm, maybe we could uhh… (Grabs the phone) Ah-ha! Too slow!!
(She holds the phone out and starts taunting Phoebe. Phoebe calming knocks the phone out of Rachel’s hand and catches it.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ah-ha! Too cocky!

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Joey is watching Jessica Lockhart perform a scene.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: I’m going to keep dating him Mother, and there’s nothing you can do about it!

content.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
content.text: Oh yes there is!

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: What are you going to do? Kill him? Like you did with Charles?!

content.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
content.text: That was an accident! And so were you.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Well, at least I’m not a murderer! (Jessica slaps her.)

content.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
content.text: Oh, my baby! (Hugs Dina, but moves Dina’s head to her other shoulder so that she’s the only one in the picture.)

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Cut!
(Joey walks up to Cecilia Monroe who plays Jessica.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That was a great scene! And-and-and that slap looks so real! How do you do that?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Oh, just years of experience.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Can I get some ice here?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh anyway, I just wanted to say how wonderful I think you are.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: You’re not the fan who’s dying are you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Say what?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I’m supposed to meet and hug a fan who’s dying, but that’s not supposed to be until (to no one in particular) later!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. No, I’m Joey Tribbiani; we did a scene together yesterday. I-I’m the guy in the coma!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Oh that was a real person?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: An-an-anyway I-I just wanted to say that since I’m getting your brain when you leave the show, I was wondering if there was any tips you can give me…

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I-I-I’m leaving the show?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know. Why? Did you hear something?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Who told you that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh uh, one of the writers.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Which one? Was it bald or was it tall?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Umm…

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Y’know what? It doesn’t matter! Because it is not true!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: And if it were true, how dare you come to me ask me for tips about a character that I’ve been playing for 20 years—I’ll give you a tip! (She throws her drink in his face.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ms. Monroe… (She slaps him) Oh there you go. (She storms off, leaving Joey standing next to Dina. They share a nod at the ferocity of the slap they just received.)

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are still arguing over the phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Phoebe! You cannot get the phone that way; that’s not fair! Okay look, I have an idea. Why don’t we, why don’t we see what kind of number he has on his speed dial, and then from that we can tell who has more in common with him. And then whoever does gets the phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or, we can decide by whose ever name is closer to the word phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine all right, but I’d bet you’d be singing another tune if we were fighting over a ratchet.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, first name on the speed dial is mom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, I lost my mom to suicide.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay no way, you cannot use that to get the cute guy and the last blueberry muffin.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Did I use that already today? I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes okay. (Checking the speed dial again.) Well now see this isn’t telling us anything. (Reading the speed dial) Joe. Carlos. Peter. Ooh! Peter Luger! T hat’s a steak house!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, a meat eater. Fine, that’s one for you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I win! He’s got Barney’s on his speed dial.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So you don’t know that’s Barney’s the store! That can be y’know his friend’s house, or a bar. Who has Barney’s the store on their speed dial?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: His new girlfriend!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica and Chandler are eating lunch, when they start to hear a horrible screeching noise. It sounds like someone is skinning a cat.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What is that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I think it’s the dying cat parade.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It sounds like it’s coming from across the street.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know that thing that Ross was gonna do at our wedding?! He was hanging out with me yesterday and he turned to me and said, “You’re half Scottish right?”

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nooo!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes!!
[Cut to Ross’s apartment, he is playing the Bagpipes, badly. He’s worse than that whole keyboard thing a few years ago.]

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, scene continued from earlier. They both get up and move to the window.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, there is no way! It can not be Ross! (She looks through the window and sees Ross practicing and fumbling around with the pipes.) Unbelievable! Why is your family Scottish?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why is your family Ross ?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He cannot play at our wedding! I mean everyone will leave! I mean come on, that is just noise! It’s not even a song!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: If you listen very carefully, I think its Celebration by Cool and the Gang .

content.description: Phoebe’s apartment, Phoebe is putting out some Sunflower seeds as Rachel enters.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi Pheebs!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How are ya?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm Pheebs, remember when we were in the coffee house we decided that I was going to keep the uh, the cute guy’s cell phone?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And remember how I said I was going to keep it in my purse so that if it rang I could just pick it up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And do you remember going into my purse and stealing the phone?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, now you lost me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You stole the phone!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No I didn’t!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No? So you’re saying that if I called it, it wouldn’t ring?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No. Umm, okay. But while you dial, let me show you the features of my new ringing handbag. (Rachel dials her phone and Phoebe’s bag starts to ring.) Oh, it does work! (Rachel grabs the phone and takes it out of Phoebe’s handbag.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is a different phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh is it?! (She answers the cute guy’s phone.) Uhh, hello? (On her phone) Yes hi, is Rachel there? (On the other phone) Yes she is, just one moment please. (To Phoebe, holding out both phones.) It’s for me!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That is damning evidence.
(The cute guy’s phone rings.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! I bet that’s him. My digital fairy tale is about to begin. I wonder how I should be? Should I be uh (In a sexy voice) Hello? Or should I be (Happily) Hi! It’s Rach… (Phoebe knocks the phone out of Rachel’s hand, catches it, and answers it.) Would you stop doing that?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello? (Listens) Yes, I’m the one who found your phone.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe! You can’t do th…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shhh! I’m on a call! (On phone) Umm well yeah, you can pick it up tonight, say 8:30? At-at my apartment. It’s umm, it’s umm 5 Morton Street, Apartment 14, umm and then maybe y’know after we can grab a bite to eat or whatever. (Listens) Okay, well okay I’ll see you then. (Listens) Bye. (Hangs up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You do know that I will be here when he comes over.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh? And how will you know what time to come over?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You just said it!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Okay, well I-I was kinda hoping that I would just…be alone y’know to think about my mom and her suicide.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh Phoebe!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! That’s the first time today!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! (Exits.)

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Dina is at the craft services table getting some food as Joey walks up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So you like the nachos uh? Myself I’m partial to…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See you in 2003. (She walks away.)

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: You’re absolutely right they are writing me out of the show. They don’t know exactly when it’s going to happen, but apparently it’s going to be very soon and that’s it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m so sorry. Look, if it was up to me you would never leave the show.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Yeah, thanks.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No I mean it! I can’t believe they would do this to you! And to your fans! I mean they are going to be devastated! Heart broken! They love you so much!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Oh you’re right. Thank you! What’s your name again?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Joey, well thank you. That is so sweet. Oh, excuse me. (She throws her drink on a passing writer.)

content.speaker: The Writer
content.text: It wasn’t my decision!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I’m having a conversation here! (To Joey) You were saying?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh yeah-ye-ye-ye-ye-ye—l-l-l-l-l-look the-the-the only reason that I, that I came up to you before was because well, I’m really nervous about-about being you. Y’know if you can help me capture the essence of the character. Y’know? Help me keep Jessica alive. Please?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: All right Joey, I will help you. Not because I-I owe it to this stupid show , but because I owe it to Jessica.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh that’s great! Oh thank you so much!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: You’re so welcome.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Now, I’ve been watching some tapes, how’s this? (In a British accent.) “Jessica Lockhart will never set foot in this place again! Ever!!”

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Is that supposed to be me?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Yeah but Jessica doesn’t have an English accent.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can do an English accent?! That baby’s going on my r�sum�!

content.description: Central Perk, Monica and Chandler are sitting on the couch. Ross is sitting on the armchair.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, I feel like a snack!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you want some shortbread? Eh that’s Scottish like you are.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no thanks. I don’t like any thing from my Scottish heritage.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well it’s just my entire family was run out of Scotland by…Vikings. Anyway, lots of bad memories. (Makes a few unintelligible noises.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh well, it sounds to me like your family is ready to uh, rediscover its Scottish roots.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! No-no they’re not. They’re still very angry! But y’know Chandler is also half-Swedish. You know what the Swedish people are famous for? Sitting down and being quiet.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well yeah-yeah the Scottish history is so much more…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You can not play bagpipes at the wedding!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: How did you know about that?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We heard you play all the way from your apartment!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Were you the ones called the cops?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s not really important right now. What is important is; while we appreciate the gesture, we just don’t feel bagpipes are appropriate for our wedding.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why not?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because we hate them.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on that’s not fair! I mean you haven’t even heard me play!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We have heard you play.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, you’ve heard my practice. Okay? Just-just give me a chance to perform for you and then decide whatever you want. And I’m not going to tell you what song I’m gonna play either. But uh, let’s just say when it’s over I’ll bet there will be a wee bit o’ celebration.

content.description: Silvercup Studios, Joey is getting pointers on how to play Jessica Lockhart.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: So, the essence of the character is rooted in her confidence. So, when Jessica enters a room for instance, she owns everything and every person in that room. (Joey is nodding.) You try.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! (He scurries out the set door and re-enters, extremely impressed) All right!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: No, he already knows that he owns everything in the room! He’s not finding it out for the first time! So, try it again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Okay. (He goes out and comes back in, glaring at everything.)

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Right. He’s not angry at the room either. Try it again, he owns it! He owns the room. It is his. He owns, owns, owns, owns the room! He owns it!! (Joey gets a snooty look on his face.) All right, it’s a little weird, but it’s getting better. (Joey is pleased.) Oh well, I’m gonna miss this woman so much. I don’t know what I’m going to do! I mean, it’s been 20 years of my life.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh well—Hey-hey! Maybe, maybe uh, maybe this is a good thing. Y’know? It’ll-it’ll give you a chance to shake things up, play different characters. You’re so talented.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I am. I am, but I don’t know, you know. An actor of a certain age is not that easy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey that’s not true! Look at uh, look at Angela Lansb—Angelina Jolie!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I probably should’ve just left years ago when the offers were pouring in, but y’know I just got so comfy here! And… Ohh, I turned down some amazing work!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Like-like what?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Well, let’s just say if I left 15 years ago, the landscape of Mexican cinema would be very different today!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: But… Well now, now’s a different time for me. (Starts to cry.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh hey come on, don’t-don’t-don’t do this! Umm, look let-let me tell you something, okay? Now when I watch you do a scene, I’m thinking, “Boy, she-she is a great actress!” (She’s not buying it.) Uh but-but, I am also thinking, “She is hot!”

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: You think I’m hot?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You own the room. (She smiles and stares longingly into his eyes.) We should probably get-get uh…

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Oh yeah-yeah, we should get the… (Pause) So when Jessica kisses a man, she usually puts umm, both her hands on the man’s face. (She does so.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-yeah, I noticed that! Is that ‘cause she’s so passionate?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: No! It’s because that way the camera only sees her! (She takes her hands off his face.) Do you wanna try it?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Okay. (He puts his hands on her face and they kiss.)

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: That was good, that was really good. But I-I think your hands may be a little off, they should be maybe right like… (She grabs the back of his neck and kisses him passionately causing them to fall onto the couch.)

content.description: Phoebe’s apartment, Phoebe and Rachel are waiting for the cute guy to show up for his cell phone. Rachel is putting on perfume by spraying it ahead of her face, and moving into it. Phoebe tries to steal some.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey! Hey!
(There is a knock on the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Who is it?

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: Hi! It’s Tom, I’m here to pick up the phone.
(Rachel excitedly jumps up and heads for the door.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Whoa! Why do you get to answer the door?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well why shouldn’t I?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Because it’s my apartment!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, then I get to give him the cell phone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. All right. (Hands her the phone.) Good luck explaining all the calls to China.
(Phoebe opens the door and Tom, an older gentleman with white hair, enters.)

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! How long were we arguing for?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re not the man who left the cell phone.

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: No that’s my assistant.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is-is he coming? (Looks hopefully out the door.)

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: Umm, no.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Could you-could you umm, give us one second?

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: Sure!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We’ll be right back sir.

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: Sure.
(They walk into the living room.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wh-what do we do?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t know!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Can you believe this? (Rachel exhales in amazement.) We were waiting for a hot guy and then an even hotter one shows up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know! (Realizes what Phoebe said.) What?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, they just don’t make ‘em like that anymore!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No-no they do but, you just have to wait.
content.parenthetical: turning and looking at Tom again

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Rachel, listen—I mean, if you let me have him then I will really owe you one.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. All right Phoebe I will let you have him, but you owe me; you owe me big!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! You’re such a great friend!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh…

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: So, which one of you lovely ladies am I going to take to dinner huh?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh that’d be me. Sir. (Hands him the cell phone.) After you.

content.speaker: Tom
content.text: Okay. Okay. (Exits and Phoebe checks him out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nice!

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Cecilia is entering the living room from Joey’s room followed by Joey.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Well, you certainly own that room.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Actually I rent the whole place and, I just got what you meant. Thank you.
(She laughs as Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!
(Rachel stops dead in her tracks when she sees whom Joey is with.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Oh my God!! Ohh, Jessica Lockhart!! In my apartment!! I am such a huge fan! I am such a huge fan!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Well, it’s nice to know that you…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica !!!! Monica !!!! (Runs to Monica’s.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That uh, that is my roommate Rachel.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Oh that explains all the women’s underwear.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sure. Yep.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! It’s true!! Oh my God you are so amazing! Oh my God, can I just ask you to do me oh, just one favor?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Certainly.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Would you slap me? Would you slap me right here in the face?! (Points to her cheek.)

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I’d love to, but my lawyer said I can’t do that anymore.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: God. You seem really, really nice.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay, bye-bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean n-not-not fake at all like most famous people.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, here we go. (He grabs them and starts to pull them out of the apartment.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh wait, just one more thing! One more minute! (To Cecilia) Umm, you’re a stupid bitch.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: I really can’t slap you. (Monica walks away angrily)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You are so beautiful.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nice to meet you! My God you’re great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks for stopping by. See ya! (Throws them out and closes the door.) (To Cecilia) I-I am so sorry. I…

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no, being adored. I’m used to it, don’t worry about it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God!
content.parenthetical: notices something in the mail that Rachel brought in

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They sent me today’s script! They never send the script!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: They don’t?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well no, I’m just in a coma. This must mean I have lines! (Realizes what that means.) Oh…

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: How does it happen?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ew, you get thrown from a horse into an electric fence.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Ah what?! Jessica hates horses!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah well, I’m guessing after this she’s not going to be crazy about electricity either.

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica have gathered to hear Ross perform his interpretation of Celebration by Cool and the Gang on the bag pipe.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …now remember you have to imagine me in a kilt.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: (To Ross) I can imagine you in a short plaid skirt and knee socks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Do you wanna start telling secrets?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Now umm, remember I’m still learning.
(As he prepares to start, he makes several horrible noises that scares Rachel into retreat.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One, two, three, four!

(He starts. And well, Celebration was never meant to be played on the bagpipe, so even the best bag pipe players in the world would have trouble with that particular song. So of course, for a beginner like Ross, it sounds absolutely dreadful. The assembled audience minus Phoebe, are horrified. Phoebe, immune to bad music, seems to enjoy it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know the song! Sing along!

(Ross resumes playing, this time accompanied by Phoebe screeching out E’s in tune with Ross. While Phoebe is singing along, Rachel is having a very difficult time keeping a straight face. Thankfully, Ross gives up after a little while.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Monica and Chandler
content.text: No!
(Ross throws the bagpipes down in disgust.)

content.description: Silvercup Studios, a scene is being shot where Dina and Fredrick are celebrating Jessica’s horrible accident by drinking champagne.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Loosening the saddle on mother’s horse was brilliant Fredrick. And the electric fence, inspired.

content.speaker: Fredrick
content.text: Thank you sweetheart. (They clink glasses.)

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: I can’t believe she’s really gone. Look around you, all of this is ours. (They move into a kiss but; they’re stopped by Joey entering with a huge bandage wrapped around his head.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Dina
content.text: Who are you?!

content.speaker: Jessica Lockhart
content.text: What’s the matter Dina? Don’t you recognize your own (Does a hair flip) mother?!

content.speaker: The Director
content.text: Cut! That was great everybody! Thank you!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: That was so wonderful! (Hugs him) Ohh, I think that you’re a better Jessica than I ever was!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh noo…

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Well of course not, but you were very good.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: And guess what? Good news! I got another job!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! Hey! Alright! Well-well what is it?!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: A film in Guadalajara!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The airport?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: No that’s La Guardia. (Joey nods in recognition.) This is Mexico.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh. Wow! Well how-how, how will you be gone?

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Eight months.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s a really long time.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: Yeah, but you can come and visit me. I bet that you could uh, own a few places down there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well I tell ya, I should probably buy a place in the city first. (Realizes.) And I just got what you meant again—That is—I tell ya, that is a tricky one!

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: That is a tricky one. Well, Joey I really wanna thank you. You’ve, well you made a very difficult time for me a little less painful.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good luck.

content.speaker: Cecilia
content.text: You too.
(They kiss and both put their hands on the other’s face like Jessica would do.)

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Chandler’s, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Monica have gathered to hear Ross perform his interpretation of Celebration by Cool and the Gang on the bag pipe. Yes, I typed that earlier. We’re seeing this again, only this time Ross as already started playing.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know the song! Sing along!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Eeee!!! Eee!! Eee!!

content.speaker: Matthew Perry
content.text: Eee!! (This causes more laughter.)

content.speaker: Lisa Kudrow
content.text: Do it again!
(Matthew mimics the sound again.)

(Why was this the trailer? Well, that’s because it was an introduction into the special out takes episode that immediately followed the show. The entire out takes episode, Friends: The Stuff You’ve Never Seen can be read by following this link.)
